words.def: get or find back
agent Agent noun  of cover; one who covers.
unpaid labor (as for the maintenance of roads) required by a lord of his vassals in lieu of taxes
a covering that serves to conceal or shelter something
someone who leads a wandering unsettled life
the number that is represented as a one followed by 7 zeros
a device for removing the core from apples
a small inlet
turn sharply
move about aimlessly or without any destination, often in search of food or employment
(cricket) the division of play during which six balls are bowled at the batsman by one player from the other team from the same end of the pitch
at any time
the fleshy, waxy covering at the base of the upper beak of some birds
a small group of indispensable persons or things
large edible mackerel of temperate United States coastal Atlantic waters
A narrow sea inlet, particularly in the Shetland Islands, similar to a fjord.
Something with the shape of the letter V. Found in compounds such as vee-necked.
(Old Testament) Adam's wife in Judeo-Christian mythology: the first woman and mother of the human race
rate of revolution of a motor
A recommendation or suggestion.
Something shaped like the letter C, such as a cee spring .
A Hebrew measure of capacity; a core or homer.
Any of several large, ferocious sea creatures, now especially the killer whale .
mythical bird of prey having enormous size and strength
A state of befuddlement; intoxication.
a mineral that contains metal that is valuable enough to be mined
to make a mistake or be incorrect
fish eggs or egg-filled ovary
City in Burkina Faso (Proper noun)
A small island.
a rare heavy polyvalent metallic element that resembles manganese chemically and is used in some alloys
a state in northwestern United States on the Pacific
a trivalent metallic element of the rare earth group
